metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0154 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient access control in subsystem for Intel (R) processor graphicsin 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families;Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R)Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R)Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6and E-2100 Processor Families may allow an authenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1126.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1130.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1063.68
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1049.52
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1062.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
